error.signature: failed to register layer: Error processing tar file: invalid argument
error.regex: overlay2.*corrupt|failed to register layer|invalid.*overlay|layer.*does not exist

verdict.summary: Docker overlay2 storage driver has corrupted layers, typically from disk errors, interrupted pulls, or filesystem issues. Containers using affected layers fail to start.

dead_ends.why_fails: The overlay2 directory structure is managed by Docker; manual edits break layer metadata and content-addressable references

dead_ends.action: Running docker system prune while containers are still using corrupted layers
dead_ends.why_fails: Prune skips in-use resources; the corrupted layers remain because containers reference them

workarounds.action: Remove the affected image and re-pull it
workarounds.how: docker rmi <image> && docker pull <image> — forces fresh download of all layers

workarounds.action: If widespread corruption, reset Docker storage entirely
workarounds.how: sudo systemctl stop docker && sudo rm -rf /var/lib/docker/overlay2 && sudo systemctl start docker — WARNING: this removes all local images and containers
workarounds.condition: when multiple images are corrupted and individual fixes are not practical

leads_to.condition: when corruption causes orphaned layers consuming disk space

preceded_by.condition: when disk-full conditions cause write errors that corrupt layers

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Overlay2 corruption means the layer data is physically damaged on disk, while cache miss means the layer is simply not present locally and needs to be re-downloaded
